Name: Two Armlets of King Psusennes the First
Description: The flexible armlets were found near the knees of the mummy of King Psusennes the First at Tanis. Each armlet consists of four main parts of gold and each of these parts has four crescents made alternately of gold and lapis lazuli. Between them are four rectangular gold plates containing cartouches with the names and titles of the owner, which read "King of Upper and Lower Egypt, the First Prophet of Amun, Psusennes, beloved of Amun." These plates are also inscribed on the inside with "The King, the First Prophet of Amun, Psusennes, son of Smendes." To attach the edges to one another, the bracelets have strings of small tubular beads of lapis lazuli and gold.
